question: まだ
sourceMnemonic: This is the adverb version of <kanji>未</kanji>, so it means the same thing: <vocabulary>not yet</vocabulary>, or <vocabulary>still</vocabulary>, depending on the context.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn it with this kanji, so here a mnemonic to help you:

Someone's telling you "<vocabulary>not yet</vocabulary>... not yet.... not yet...". You have some food on your nose, but you're not allowed to eat it <reading>今</reading> (<ja>いま</ja>).

Note that this word can also be read <ja>まだ</ja>. However, <ja>いまだ</ja> is often written in kanji, while <ja>まだ</ja> is almost always written in kana. So when you see <ja>未だ</ja>, it's a safe bet to read it as <ja>いまだ</ja>!
